## Analyzing the hand:
- Pair of 10s (10 of Clubs position 4, 10 of Diamonds position 6)
- Two face cards: King of Clubs (position 3) and Jack of Diamonds (position 5)
- King of Clubs is a Glass Card (X2 Mult)
- Four Diamonds: Jack, 10, 6, 4

Still no Three of a Kind. Let me check my options:

### Option 1: Play the pair of 10s with the King (3 cards)
Playing positions 3, 4, 6 (King of Clubs, 10 of Clubs, 10 of Diamonds)
- Hand type: Pair


- Base: 10 chips, 2 mult
- Card chips: 10 (King) + 10 (10C) + 10 (10D) = 30 chips
- Total chips: 10 + 30 = 40 chips
- Mult: 2 base
  - +5 from Smiley Face (King is a face card)
  - +20 from Half Joker (3 cards)
  - = 27 mult
  - Glass Card X2 Mult = 54 mult
  - Constellation X1.3 = 70.2 mult
- Final score: 40 × 70.2 = 2,808 chips

Need to verify the order of operations though. The Glass Card enhancement applies when the King scores during the card evaluation phase, so the X2 multiplier takes effect at that point. Base multiplier starts at 2, then Smiley Face adds 5 for the face card, Half Joker contributes 20 from the three cards played, reaching 27 before the Glass Card doubles it to 54, and Constellation multiplies the final multiplier by 1.3 to get 70.2.

With 40 chips from the three tens, that gives 2,808 chips total—still not enough. I should explore other options like continuing to discard and search for a Three of a Kind, since there are only 2 tens left in the remaining 35 cards.

Let me recalculate the Glass Card and Smiley Face interactions more carefully. When the King of Clubs is scored, it triggers both the Glass Card's X2 multiplier and the Smiley Face's +5 multiplier simultaneously.

Scoring the three cards (King, 10, 10):
- King of Clubs: 10 chips, then Glass Card doubles mult to 4, Smiley Face adds 5 for 9 total mult
- The two 10s each add 10 chips
- Half Joker contributes +20 mult after all cards score
- Constellation applies X1.3 to the final multiplier

This gives 40 chips × 37.7 mult = 1,508 chips, which still falls short. Trying a different combination with the Jack might yield better results. 41.6 mult

Final: 65 × 41.6 = 2,704 chips

This clears the 2000 chip threshold. Let me verify the scoring sequence though—cards activate left to right, with each triggering its base chips, then enhancements and seals, then any "on scored" Jokers before moving to the next card. After all cards finish, independent Jokers like Half Joker and Constellation apply their effects. Rechecking with the King, Jack, and 10 in positions 3, 5, and 6: King adds 10 chips and gets doubled by Glass for 2 mult, then Smiley adds 5 for 7 total. Jack contributes another 10 chips and 5 mult from Smiley. The 10 adds 10 more chips. Half Joker then multiplies by 20, and Constellation multiplies the result by 1.3, giving 41.6 mult against 35 chips—only 1,456 total. I need to try using both 10s instead to get enough chips.

With both 10s and Jack, I'd have 45 chips but lose the Half Joker trigger since they're in positions 3-6. Even with Constellation's 1.3x multiplier on 12 mult, this only reaches 702 chips. I should discard and look for Three of a Kind, since Wily Joker's +100 chips bonus would give me the score I need.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
